snippet: In “Ebony and Ivy,” Craig Steven Wilder, an M.I.T. historian, takes a broad look at the role of slavery in the growth of America’s earliest universities.
abstract: Massachusetts Institute of Technology historian Craig Steven Wilder takes a broad look at the role of slavery in the growth of America’s earliest colleges in his book Ebony and Ivy: Race, Slavery, and the Troubled History of America's Universities.
lead_paragraph: In “Ebony and Ivy,” Craig Steven Wilder, an M.I.T. historian, takes a broad look at the role of slavery in the growth of America’s earliest universities.

headline.seo: ‘Ebony and Ivy,’ About How Slavery Helped Universities Grow
